revised_title: Molecular Mechanisms of Cell Locomotion: The Role of Actin Filaments and Associated Proteins
tldr: The article discusses the molecular biology of cell locomotion, focusing on the structure and function of cortical cytoplasm. It explains how actin-rich networks in cortical cytoplasm generate directional forces for cell movement and shape changes. The article also describes the role of actin-binding proteins, such as gelsolin and actumenin, in controlling actin filament length and regulating the assembly state of the actin network.
